# Requirements Document

## Introduction

This specification addresses the visual issue of dark/black areas appearing on the sides of the AI Knowledge Base frontend application. The current layout has unwanted dark regions that detract from the user experience and need to be removed to create a clean, professional interface.

## Glossary

- **Frontend_Application**: The React-based user interface for the AI Knowledge Base system
- **Layout_Container**: The main layout wrapper that controls the overall page structure
- **Dark_Areas**: The unwanted black/dark colored regions visible on the sides of the interface
- **Responsive_Design**: Layout that adapts properly to different screen sizes

## Requirements

### Requirement 1

**User Story:** As a user, I want to see a clean interface without dark areas on the sides, so that I can focus on the content without visual distractions.

#### Acceptance Criteria

1. WHEN a user loads the application THEN the Frontend_Application SHALL display without any dark/black areas on the sides
2. WHEN the browser window is resized THEN the Frontend_Application SHALL maintain proper layout without creating dark areas
3. WHEN the application is viewed on different screen sizes THEN the Frontend_Application SHALL use the full available width appropriately
4. WHEN the theme is switched between light and dark modes THEN the Frontend_Application SHALL maintain consistent background colors without unwanted dark regions
5. WHEN content is displayed THEN the Layout_Container SHALL use appropriate background colors that match the selected theme

### Requirement 2

**User Story:** As a developer, I want the CSS styles to be properly configured, so that the layout renders correctly across different browsers and devices.

#### Acceptance Criteria

1. WHEN the root element styles are applied THEN the Frontend_Application SHALL use appropriate background colors for the current theme
2. WHEN the layout components are rendered THEN the Frontend_Application SHALL ensure proper container sizing and positioning
3. WHEN overflow properties are set THEN the Frontend_Application SHALL prevent unwanted scrollbars while maintaining proper content visibility
4. WHEN responsive breakpoints are triggered THEN the Frontend_Application SHALL adapt the layout without creating visual artifacts
